publisher.value: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)

description.value: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the SDC Form Filler role when conforming to the ONC's Structured Data Capture FHIR implementation guide. This role is responsible for retrieving pre-defined forms, requesting pre-population of forms and/or auto-populating forms, guiding the user through verifying populated data and submitting completed or partially-completed forms.

documentation.value: The Questionnaire and ValueSet resources are retrieved to allow the system to guide the user through the entry process. The Binary and DocumentReference resources allow the system to find existing clinical documents that can be within the pre-population process. (Support for retrieval operations on these resources is optional as the relevant CDA or FHIR structures may also be directly gendeated by the Form Filler itself.) Finally, the QuestionnaireAnswer resource is used to record the populated form.

description.value: Implementations must meet the general security requirements documented in the SDC implementation guide.

documentation.value: SHALL. Allows discovery of existing questionnaires to be completed
SHOULD. Allows retrieval of a specific questionnaire by id. Allows systems to maintain a 'favorites' list of forms and retrieve them by id.
MAY. Allows review of changes made to a questionnaire over time. Of interest to some systems, but probably not most.
MAY. Allows retrieval of a historical version of a questionnaire. Most systems will make use of the current version only.
SHALL. Allows retrieval of a specific value set by id (as referenced in a Questionnaire)
SHOULD. Allows retrieval of a specific version of a value set (as referenced in a Questionnaire)
MAY. Allows review of changes to a value set over time. Of interest to some systems, but probably not most.
SHALL. Allows a user to search for existing completed or partially-completed forms. Generally used to find partially-completed forms for update.
SHALL. Allows recording a completed or partially-completed form
SHALL. Allows updating an existing completed or partially-completed form. (Systems may place rules on who can update forms and under what circumstances.)

SHALL. Allows removal of a completed form from a repository. Note that the removal may be logical rather than physical. Some systems may have rules for who can remove a completed form and under what circumstances.
SHOULD. Allows review of prior versions of an answer set - allows reversion to previously recorded versions
SHOULD. Allows checking an answer set for validity against submission rules without persisting any data
SHOULD. Allows discovery of existing documents that may be included in a form pre-population request
SHOULD. Allows retrieval of a specific binary (as pointed to by a DocumentReference)
MAY. Allows retrieval of a historical version of a binary. In general, the most recent version would be appropriate, but some may prefer to use the specific version referenced by a DocumentReference.
